intro: Calandrinia racemosa, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvidae family and is characterized by its striking, showy red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has erect, branching stems and small, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in arid and semi-arid environments. Calandrinia racemosa is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
